title: Chapter 136
content: # Chapter 136 Every gamer knew the truth: levels didn't lie. Satisfy had revolutionized the world with its virtual reality system, but at its core, it was still a game. Level remained the most fundamental measure of power. Every level granted 10 stat points. More stats meant more strength. Higher levels unlocked better equipment and stronger skills. But the real advantage ran deeper than simple numbers. At certain thresholds, the stats themselves evolved. Take Strength, for example. Below Level 100, each point granted 0.1 Attack Power, 3 Health, and 20 Weight Limit. Above Level 100? That became 0.2 Attack Power, 5 Health, and 30 Weight Limit. At Level 200, the growth accelerated further: 0.3 Attack Power, 7 Health, and 40 Weight Limit per point. This exponential scaling triggered every hundred levels. Players called it Stats Awakening. The higher you climbed, the wider the gap between you and those below. Grid, however, existed outside this paradigm. At a mere Level 170, he'd knocked down four rankers above Level 200. He'd slaughtered dozens of Level 260 griffons. Hundreds more had fallen to his blade over the past four days. The legendary class didn't just bend the rules. It shattered them. Toban watched Grid skin another griffon carcass. *Epic hidden classes are already considered powerhouses. But a legendary class? This is absurd.* They'd camped in the griffon habitat for four days straight, hunting without pause. Toban wiped sweat from his brow. The question had been building in his mind for hours. "Grid." He kept his voice casual. "How did you get a legendary class?" Hidden classes required immense effort and a healthy dose of luck. Legendary classes? Those were statistical impossibilities. Toban wanted to know the story. Maybe he could learn something. At the very least, it would make for entertaining conversation. Grid's expression darkened. The memories clawed at him. Months of suffering. Dozens of deaths. Everything he'd owned, stripped away piece by piece. His stomach churned. "Don't ask." Toban caught the look on Grid's face and backed off immediately. *Shit. Touched a nerve.* *He must've gone through hell. Of course getting a legendary class wouldn't be easy. I should drop it.* Four days. They'd been grinding in this griffon habitat for four full days. Grid had gained 10 levels and reached Level 180. Toban suspected Grid wanted to hit Level 200 before moving on. The problem? Toban was getting nothing. No experience. No items. Just the privilege of wearing Malacus' Cloak and playing bait while Grid reaped all the rewards. His number one spot on the paladin rankings—the position he'd defended for months—was slipping away. Damian was probably closing the gap right now. Toban shifted his weight. "Grid. We should wrap this up. Don't you have a quest to finish?" "Hrmm..." Grid scratched his chin. The experience here was incredible. *If I could just stay until Level 200...* He shook his head. *Bad idea.* *It took four days to gain 10 levels. Twenty levels would take at least eight more days. That's too long.* His eyes drifted to Toban. *And honestly... I feel a little bad for him.* The realization surprised him. He'd been treating Toban like a slave. Somewhere around day two, a tiny seed of guilt had sprouted. It felt foreign. Uncomfortable. *He's a ranker. I can't keep using him for free. This is a good stopping point.* Something had changed in him. Grid felt remorse for exploiting another person. When had that happened? *No. I need to stay ruthless. This world doesn't reward kindness.* He frowned at the sky. *Why did God make me so soft-hearted?* Grid gathered his equipment. "Let's go." "Finally!" Toban's shoulders sagged with relief. No more playing bait for griffons. No more watching Grid collect all the loot. Freedom was within reach. They reached the Judar Sanctum in less than a day. Toban stopped at the entrance. His expression turned serious. "Leader Pascal is after the Holy Light Set." He met Grid's eyes. "He might be hostile. If there's a fight, I can't help you. You understand?" Grid shrugged. "I'm used to fighting alone." *How could the leader of the Judar Church be stronger than the Pope?* Grid had killed Pope Drevigo. Pascal would be easy by comparison. Still, better to check his progress. *Know yourself before knowing the enemy.* "Status window." The familiar blue screen materialized. --- > **[Status Window]** > > **Name:** Grid > **Level:** 180 (140,090/5,531,200) > **Class:** Pagma's Descendant > > * The probability of adding additional options when making items will increase. > * The probability of item enhancement will increase. > * All equipment items can be worn unconditionally. However, there is a penalty depending on the rating of the item. > > **Title:** One who Became a Legend > * Abnormal conditions don't work well on you. > * You won't die when health is at the minimum. > * Easily acknowledged. > > **Title:** First Unique Item Maker > * Dexterity +200 > > **Title:** Only Legendary Item Maker > * Dexterity +350 > > **Title:** Knight Slayer > * Stamina +100 > * Strength +30 > > **Title:** Apostle of Justice > * All stats +10 > * The Apostle of Justice's bravery is unmatched. > > **Health:** 29,560/29,560 (+7,000) > **Mana:** 3,240/3,240 > > **Strength:** 1,584 > **Stamina:** 962 > **Agility:** 417 > **Intelligence:** 439 (+200) > **Dexterity:** 984 > **Persistence:** 498 > **Composure:** 364 > **Indomitable:** 414 > **Dignity:** 364 > **Insight:** 664 > **Courage:** 308 > > **Stat Points:** 0 > **Weight:** 25,519/57,480 > > **[Ability Details]** > > **Basic Attack Power:** 325 > **Weapon Attack Power:** 412~579 > **Additional Attack Power:** > * Pagma's Swordsmanship Lv.1 (Deactivated): 20% additional attack power > * God Dominion's Blessing: 15% additional attack power > > **Total Attack Power:** 995~1,220 > > **Basic Magic Power:** 220 > **Item Magic Power:** 100 > **Additional Magic Power:** None > **Total Magic Power:** 320 > > **Basic Defense:** 192 > **Item Defense:** 539 > **Additional Defense:** > * Holy Light Battle Gear Set: Defense +500 > > **Total Defense:** 1,231 --- Grid scanned the numbers. At Level 100, he'd crossed the first Stats Awakening threshold. Each point of Strength now granted 0.2 Attack Power instead of 0.1. Stamina provided 0.2 Defense per point. Intelligence gave 0.5 Magic Power. His base stats far exceeded other users at the same level. All those items he'd crafted had paid dividends in permanent stat gains. But the penalties gnawed at him. *Look at this bullshit.* His +5 Dainsleif had an attack power of 549~772. The 25% penalty reduced that to 412~579. His armor penalties ranged from 40% to 55%. So much wasted potential. *Being able to wear anything regardless of requirements should make me broken. Instead, I'm stuck with these goddamn penalties.* He closed the window with a gesture. *Whatever. It worked against the Pope.* Grid had been 30 levels lower when he'd killed Drevigo. His defense had been far worse. He'd still won. "Okay. Let's do this." He approached the entrance. A paladin in white armor blocked his path. Grid produced Isabel's letter of recommendation. "I'm here to see Leader Pascal." The paladin examined the letter. His stern expression softened. He stepped aside and gestured toward the interior. "Welcome, Sir Grid. The leader has been expecting you." Grid blinked. *What?* He glanced back. Toban had vanished behind a pillar. A whisper arrived in his ear. *—Grid, I'm sorry but I can't go in with you. If the leader sees me, he'll be furious.* Grid rolled his eyes. *Coward.* He proceeded alone into the sanctum. The smell of roasted meat and exotic spices hit him first. Long tables groaned under the weight of elaborate dishes. At the head of the room stood a man in golden robes. Pascal, the 11th leader of the Judar Church, spread his arms wide. "I am honored to meet the person who received the blessings of Goddess Rebecca and God Dominion!" His smile was warm. Too warm. Pascal was ambitious, yes. But he wasn't stupid. He'd heard about Grid's victory over Malacus. The recognition from both the Rebecca Church and the Dominion Church. Only a fool would antagonize someone with that much political capital. Besides, Grid had done him a favor. *The Pope's seat is vacant. I'm the obvious choice to fill it.* Pascal's smile widened. *The Holy Light Set would've been nice, but I don't need it. I'll become Pope regardless.* Few in the Rebecca Church had the credentials to compete for the position. The leader of the Dominion Church wasn't the ambitious type. Pascal's path was clear. *I should be thanking Grid. He removed my biggest obstacle.* "Please." Pascal gestured to a chair. "I would love to hear the story of how you defeated the demon Malacus and the corrupt Pope Drevigo. Sit. Eat. The food will grow cold." Grid sat. The conversation lasted hours. By the end, his affinity with Pascal had soared. The pavranium received God Judar's blessing without incident. Grid examined the updated item description. --- > **[Golden Discs Made of Pavranium]** > > **Durability:** Infinite > > Golden discs made of pavranium, the strongest mineral produced by the collaboration between the legendary blacksmith Pagma and the legendary great magician Braham. > > By default, they revolve around and protect their owner. They will also take other actions when given commands from their owner. > > * They have obtained healing skills due to Goddess Rebecca's blessing. They will increase their owner's health recovery speed by **300%**. > * They have obtained an attack buff skill due to God Dominion's blessing. The owner's attack power will increase by **15%**. > * They have obtained a defense buff skill due to God Judar's blessing. The owner's defense will increase by **15%**. > > **Weight:** 3 --- *Perfect.* Three down. One to go. The journey was almost complete. Pascal's expression grew apologetic. "But Grid, there's a problem. Finding the sanctum of the Yatan Church is virtually impossible. They operate in complete secrecy. The location has never been exposed in recorded history. You need God Yatan's blessing? That might take some time." Grid's stomach sank. He spoke with Toban afterward. Neither of them had any leads on the Yatan Sanctum's location. *This could take weeks. Months.* Grid returned to Winston without achieving his goal. The city was in chaos. "What the hell? Is this an event?" Users crowded the streets. At the city entrance, NPCs lined up in formation. Soldiers. Knights. Phoenix stood among them. Even Lady Irene had come out. The Tzedakah Guild members were there too. Rumors said they'd sworn loyalty to Irene recently. "Maybe the King is visiting?" "Has to be. He probably heard about Winston's development and came to inspect personally." A king sighting was rare. Some players believed just seeing royalty could grant stat bonuses. Thousands of users packed the walls and square, craning their necks toward the gates. The crowd held its breath. Finally, the gates swung open. A figure entered. The soldiers verified his identity and blew their trumpets once. Knights drew their swords in salute. Citizens smiled and threw flower petals. But it wasn't the King. It wasn't even an NPC. A scruffy user in beginner-quality gear shuffled through the gates. He wore a wide-brimmed hat pulled low, obscuring his face and nameplate. As if he'd expected the attention. Lady Irene ran toward him. "Huh?" The crowd's confusion erupted in a chorus of bewildered murmurs. Irene, the goddess of Winston, beloved by thousands of male players for her beauty and kindness, threw her arms around the mysterious beginner. "I've missed you so much." She gazed up at him with open affection. "What the fuck?" "This has to be a bug." Why would such a beautiful, noble NPC embrace a user like that? While the crowd reeled, another figure approached. Jishuka, one of the most beautiful women in the world, walked up to the beginner. Her usually cold expression had softened into a genuine smile. "You came back safely. I was waiting anxiously." "No way..." The users stood frozen. Winston's Lady came from an influential NPC family. The top-ranked beauty Jishuka, greeting this nobody like an old friend. The scene exploded across social media within minutes. News outlets around the world picked up the story. Internet forums erupted in heated debate. "Who the hell is that guy?" --- After dinner, Sehee curled up on the couch next to Youngwoo. The evening news played on the TV. Footage of the mysterious beginner's welcome parade filled the screen. Sehee leaned forward. "I wonder who that is." She didn't play Satisfy herself, but she'd absorbed enough from TV coverage to understand why this was newsworthy. "He looks like a total noob. Why are all these important people fawning over him?" Youngwoo yawned. "That's me." "...What?" "I was away on a quest for a while. Everyone was welcoming me back." Youngwoo grinned. "Pretty popular, right?" **CRACK.** The TV remote in Sehee's hand made a sickening crunch. Plastic shards scattered across the couch. Youngwoo clicked his tongue. "Wow. That remote was ten years old, but still. How does it just break like that? The manufacturer must use garbage materials. We shouldn't buy their products again." "Argh!" Sehee glared at her brother and stormed off to her room. Once she was gone, Youngwoo sprawled across the couch. Fatigue pulled at his eyelids. Within seconds, he'd dozed off. A sly chuckle drifted through the living room. "...The first night... Hehehehe." --- **[Author's Note]** Too busy tomorrow, so here are the chapters early. Also, no Q&A this month.
